thread.title: Europe's Car Industry Shifts Earnings Speeds -- At A Glance
thread.title_full: Europe's Car Industry Shifts Earnings Speeds -- At A Glance

title: Europe's Car Industry Shifts Earnings Speeds -- At A Glance
text:
Print BMW Raises Red Flag for Chinese Market 
A sharp drop in second-quarter operating profit at BMW’s car-making arm and a warning of possibly tougher conditions to come in China have given investors pause. Volkswagen similarly reported weaker China earnings. 
Mercedes-Benz Is on a Roll 
Daimler turned in surprisingly strong earnings as new models like the C-Class sedan drove sales higher even in China. The German auto maker’s car division reported its first double-digit operating profit margin for years which at 10.5% compares well with market leader BMW’s 8.4%. 
Peugeot Powers Up 
PSA Peugeot Citroën, Europe’s No. 2 by production after Volkswagen, bounced back with its first net profit since 2011 in the six months through June. Peugeot got a boost from the recovering European market, on which it is heavily reliant, and recent cost cutting. 
Renault Overshadowed 
Peugeot’s turnaround put a robust performance by rival Renault in the shade. Despite better sales and earnings, Renault’s operating profitability is improving only slowly. The shares fell 8% on the day of its earnings. More from The Wall Street Journal
